STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 9, 2021
Jody Schlaufman
Otsego/Crawford/Oscoda DHHS
931 S. Otsego Ave
Gaylord, MI 49735
RE: License #: CP690201347
Otsego/Crawford/Oscoda DHHS
931 S. Otsego Ave
Gaylord, MI 49735
Dear Ms. Schlaufman:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 08/19/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation Sustainability, and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(a) A summary of the services provided during care up to the
time of the change in placement and the needs that remain to
be met.
Two of 2 closed foster care services files reviewed did not have documented in
MiSACWIS (Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System) a
summary of the services provided and the needs that remain to be met.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(5) If an agency is no longer providing services to the child in a
foster home, then both of the following shall be documented
before a change in placement:
(b) Provision for any continuing services.
Two of 2 closed foster care services files reviewed did not have documented in
MiSACWIS (Michigan Statewide Automated Child Welfare Information System)
provision for any continuing services.
R 400.12505 Supervision.
(2) An agency shall provide the following minimum supervision:
(a) Face-to-face contact between the social service worker
and the youth in independent living at least once each month at
a youth's place of residence.
One of 2 independent living files reviewed did not have monthly visitation between
the youth and the social service worker documented. One visit was on 03/19/2021
and the next visit was on 06/17/2021.
4

R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service plan
must address the living arrangement for the child or children,
visitation/parenting time with the youth's biological children or a
clear explanation why this is not possible or appropriate.
Two of 2 independent living file reviewed had initial service plans which were beyond
the 30-calendar day requirement of the above rule. One file had an initial service
plan 57 days beyond the rule and the other was 81 days beyond the above rule.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements except for the following:
5

SRM 200 Fingerprints
All personnel, contractors, vendors, and external auditors who
have access to CW-CHRI are required to complete Security
Awareness Training (SAT). Training is available on the Learning
Management System (LMS) for MDHHS personnel and contractors
with access to LMS. Non-contracted agencies will complete Finger
Print Security Awareness Training via the MDHHS public licensing
website.
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years thereafter.
CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all personnel with CHRI
access completes SAT timely. DCWL field consultants will monitor
completion of SAT for all CPAs as part of the annual licensing
inspection.
Six of 7 employees who have access to CW-CHRI did not have updated Security
Awareness Training (SAT) training as required by the policy.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
Technical assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
No consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period, which was approved on 09/10/2020. The
plan addressed rule violations at the Renewal Inspection completed on 10/19/2020.
The corrective action plan addressed both initial and updated service plans being
timely. Since the above citation in this report is the timeliness of Independent Living
Service Plans there is no repeat violations.
6

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
August 23, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 9, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
